snippet: The omnibus bill bundling together an overhaul of the civil service and a new tax code, along with other budget cuts, was endorsed by 153 lawmakers in the 300-seat House.
abstract: Greece’s Parliament narrowly approves barrage of new austerity measures, including contentious plan for thousands of layoffs and wage cuts for civil service workers; approval paves way for release of additional crucial financing from country’s foreign creditors but raises questions about stability of fragile coalition that is to enforce cuts.
lead_paragraph: The omnibus bill bundling together an overhaul of the civil service and a new tax code, along with other budget cuts, was endorsed by 153 lawmakers in the 300-seat House.
